channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A major power outage is reported in Spain and Portugal, disabling their capitals
item.description: Subway networks, phone lines, traffic lights, ATM machines and more were knocked offline in the two countries and parts of France around midday Monday...

item.title: Conclave to choose the next pope starts May 7, Vatican says
item.description: The decision was made at the Fifth General Congregation, held on Monday morning in the Vatican's Synod Hall. The conclave will take place in the Vatic...

item.title: Trump administration tries to ramp up deportations. And, a look at Canada's election
item.description: Critics say the Trump administration is making mistakes as it tries to drive up deportation numbers. And, Canada's election for the next prime ministe...

item.title: DHL reverses course and resumes shipping packages valued over $800 to U.S. consumers
item.description: The policy reversal comes one week after the global shipping company said it would halt such shipments due to new U.S. customs rules.

item.title: As a diversity grant dies, young scientists fear it will haunt their careers
item.description: The Trump administration defunded the National Institute of Health's MOSAIC grant program, which launched the careers of scientists from diverse backg...

item.title: Mob chased Brooklyn woman after mistaking her for protester at speech by Israeli security minister
item.description: A New York City woman says she feared for her life as she was chased, kicked and pelted with objects by a mob of men who mistook her as a participant ...

item.title: IBM announces $150 billion investment in U.S. manufacturing, research
item.description: IBM announces $150 billion investment in U.S. which it says will fuel economic growth, create U.S. jobs.

item.title: Former Memphis officers to face second trial in beating death of Tyre Nichols
Critical week for US's future in Ukraine-Russia talks, Rubio says
item.description: It is a "very critical" week for the White House and its involvement, Secretary of State Marco Rubio tells US media.

item.title: Mar 24: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: White House narrowing scale of April 2 tariffs; U.S. to revoke legal status of more than 500,000 migrants, urging them to self deport.

item.title: Police raids across France after wave of prison attacks
item.description: Police make 25 arrests so far as officers target Paris, Marseille, Bordeaux and, the city of Lyon.

item.title: What to know about the trial of an ex-Michigan cop charged in the killing of a Black motorist
Dozens of African migrants killed in US strike on Yemen, Houthis say
item.description: Houthi-run media report the bodies of 68 people have been recovered from a migrant detention centre in Saada.

item.title: Large parts of Spain and Portugal hit by massive power outage
item.description: A widespread power outage hit Spain and Portugal, which have a combined population of over 50 million people.

item.title: Conclave to elect new pope to begin on 7 May, Vatican says
item.description: The closed-door meeting will begin in the Sistine Chapel and will involve some 135 cardinals from across the world.

item.title: Putin declares unilateral 3-day truce in Ukraine to mark Russian holiday
item.description: After being accused of violating the last short-term truce, President Vladimir Putin says Russia will halt its war in Ukraine for three days to mark 8...

item.title: Putin announces three-day Russian ceasefire in Ukraine from 8 May
item.description: Ukraine calls for an "immediate" ceasefire of at least 30 days in response.

item.title: Cicada maps show where the insects will emerge in the U.S. this spring
item.description: A large brood of periodical cicadas is due to emerge in the spring of 2025. These maps show where people should expect to see, and hear, the bugs this...
